summary: This is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys discussing the production timeline for documents in response to a FOIA request related to Jeffrey Epstein. The primary concern is ensuring all interviews and processes supporting legal withholdings are completed by a June 25, 2021, deadline set by the Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject ('in Noel') in the context of interviews and processes that must be completed to support legal withholdings for a FOIA production deadline.

events.title: FOIA Production Deadline
events.description: Deadline for the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) to produce documents without redactions in response to an Epstein-related FOIA request, contingent on completion of supporting interviews/processes.

keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons (BOP) had a June 25, 2021, deadline to produce documents without redactions in response to an Epstein FOIA request.
The production was contingent on the completion of interviews or other processes related to an individual or case referred to as 'Noel' to support legal withholdings under exemption 7(A).
Interviews or processes were scheduled for June 17 and June 22, 2021, with flexibility for rescheduling.

The correspondence is between Assistant United States Attorneys from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), indicating ongoing legal and investigative activity related to Epstein in mid-2021.
The document reference 'EFTA00091619' is part of a larger dataset, suggesting this is one piece of released FOIA material.
